title: Mafia
description: Michael meets with an insurance salesman that visits the office and is later convinced by Dwight and Andy that he is part of the mafia.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The fundamentals of business. The funda-mentals of business. "Mental" is part of the word, I have underlined it. Because you're mental, if you don't have a good time. You have to enjoy it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well the "fun" is in it. [conference room group chimes agreement.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Get out.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [halfway out] Yeah, I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. So, it all starts with a handshake.  But you can't just go right to the selling, you need "small talk."  What topics can you use for small talk?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Golf.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stock market.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dave Matthews.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, what else?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Uh, small things. Peas, ball bearings, dimes...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: The weekend!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah! That's good! Come on up! Meredith, come up here. Let's do a little something. So Meredith and I have just started conversing and I will say, "So Meredith, how was your weekend, what did you do?"

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Well I caught my son taking a dump on the upper part of the toilet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: He calls it an upper decker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. God. What you people don't know about business, I could fill a book with.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Then do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Write a book.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [into mini recorder] The fundamentals of business by Michael Scott. Over one billion sold. More than the Bible, I'm not surprised. Chapter one. The businessman...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Michael walks in office, man waits on couch] Mr. Grotti, this is Michael Scott. He's the person you should talk to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hi. I'm sorry, just a sec. [whispers] Erin, you're supposed to be the gatekeeper, do you have any idea how valuable my time is?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: In your schedule it just says nine til noon is "creative space" and I thought this could be part of that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you know how creative space works? Okay I just cancelled my afternoon.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You don't have anything in the afternoon. It just says "free play."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Push free play til tomorrow morning. [to Grotti] Hi. Sorry. Crazy day. You're seeing how the sausage gets made.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come in the conference room and I will show you a finished sausage.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: As a manager of business, you have a lot of pride.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: But you also got a lot of responsibility

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: None greater perhaps, than your need to be sure, that your small or large business is secure in the event of a covered loss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is nothing more insulting to a great salesman, than having to listen to a bad salesman. It's like a great basketball player having to listen to a bad basketball player.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim's gone on his honeymoon. So I started borrowing his office to fart in. Then one day I came in and I just stayed. Cause this place is awesome. It feels like home now. Even better than my home. My home sucks.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think you're right. It definitely looks suspicious. And his southern Italian heritage raises some flags.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: God forbid you...  should have a fire in the warehouse.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yup. Yeah, definitely. All that paper burning up.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Yeah, and a truck, goes off the side of the road, there's injury.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhm, I hear you. The truck.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: You will be hearing from me Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: I can be very very persistent.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do your worst. [they shake hands]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Grotti knocks over coat stand grabbing his overcoat] Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Would you look at that people? What an unpredictable world we live in, huh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What happened in there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing, other than once again, I am just thankful that I am a paper salesman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did he threaten you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No Dwight, not everything is a threat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Mobsters are!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is no such things as monsters.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: He drives an SUV!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I knew it! More trunk space. Or should I say, corpse space.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey guys, I drive a SUV, does that mean I'm in the mob?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, not that, by itself. But look at all the facts. He seems like a mobster.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wait, when did we start talking about the mob? The guy was trying to sell me insurance.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All mobsters have a front, sometimes it's selling insurance, sometimes it's waste management or sanitation.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: For the record, not all Italian-Americans are in the Mafia.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think, he just seemed like he was just trying to sell me insurance.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, buy my insurance or I'll burn your warehouse down!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Exactly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He did talk about a fire in the warehouse...  and he also vaguely threatened me with testicular cancer.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Uhh. All right, who else is here? [looks around]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam and Jim are on their honeymoon. So there's not the usual balance between "sane and others." Toby has mentally checked out since June. It's a very dangerous time. The "coalition for reason" is extremely weak.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oscar says I checked out huh?  Huh. [nods head]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [over chatter] Hey, hey hey, calm down. Calm down. Calm down.  Ryan, you lived in New York, what do you think?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Well first of all, there is no such thing as 'The Mafia.'

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What you have are specific families. What's the guy's last name?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um it is, Grotti.

quotes.speaker: {Andy} and {Dwight}
quotes.text: [groans] Oh no. Fabulous.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What? What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's John Gotti, you idiot!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's, it's a completely different name!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: So he won't get caught!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. It's pretty close.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No, what are you talking about, what mobster would change his name from Gotti to Grotti. It weakens it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No I disagree. "R" is among the most menacing of sounds. That's why they call it "murder." And not "muck-duck."

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay too many different words coming at me from too many different sentences.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Lock your door!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not gonna lock my door.  [door closes. Then clicks locked]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Jim? It's Oscar. I'm so sorry to be calling you on your honeymoon.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oscar! Uh, what is going on?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's Michael, he thinks he's being shaken down by the mob. I don't know how you usually handle this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Look, We're in Puerto Rico, so-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Oscar.  It's Pam. Hey. We're on our honeymoon.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam, I'm sorry-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Unless someone very close to us is in immediate physical danger, you should not be calling us.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're right. You're right. [Pam hangs up] Oh, okay bye.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's Grotti. He's following up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Already? This, this guy is persistent!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reads email] "I feel that you will regret missing this great opportunity to be in business."

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. What are my options here? Do I just ignore it, or?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah right! You heard him! He's gonna burn down the warehouse or run one of our trucks off the road.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, I'm calling the police.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [hangs up, rips cord from phone] That is the stupidest thing you could do right now!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's right. Cops can't do anything until a crime has been reported.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not only that, but if they find out you snitched, you get a dead horses chopped off head in your bed!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not gonna happen.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's an exaggeration.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's how it works!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What am I supposed to do here?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: When somebody threatens you, you give in right away. Okay you need to buy insurance from this guy and get him off your back

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was thinking exactly the same thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, criminals are like raccoons. Okay, you give 'em a taste of cat food pretty soon they'll be back for the whole cat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The only way to defeat a bully is to stand up to him. Trust me, I have bullied a lot of people.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, I don't know about that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wait let's hear him out, this is interesting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Here's what we do. We meet him in a public place. Ask him to lunch or something like that, some place he can't be openly violent.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let him know you're not the typical kind of guy that he can shake down. That you're stubborn. That you might even be a little bit dangerous.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [snaps fingers] I like this plan. I'd like to officially withdraw my plan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hold on, hold on! Just-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, no, no. My plan is out! We do this the hard way.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. I will meet with him, but I'm not going alone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well you're gonna have to. [overlaps] Dwight:

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Andy dressed as a mechanic, Cornell hat on] What are you wearing? Who's Pat?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well if I'm gonna back you up, I need a weapon without drawing suspicion, and I have to justify it somehow so, I'm a mechanic with a tire thing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you know how to use it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: To change tires, no. But it's metal, I can hit somebody with it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's go, come on. [whispers] God!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Should I change?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're wearing loafers!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Forget it! Forget it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Andy is playing with the tire iron] Take that thing off the table! Please!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well then I can't use it. I'm just gonna hide it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey. Bathroom checks out clean. Nothing behind the toilet except for this roach motel.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh! God! [smacks roaches]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You'll never kill it that way. You want to separate the head from the thorax-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, guys. Cool it. There he is, there he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Mr. Scott.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mr. Grotti we meet again. These are my associates.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Hi. Angelo Grotti.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: So, you got this table?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: This is one of those half booths, can't-decide-what-it-is type of thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Waitress, we're gonna sit over here.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: That's fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [answers phone] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Credit Card Rep.
quotes.text: Hello Mr. Halpert. I'm calling from the identity theft department at Capital One. We've detected some unusual activity on your credit card.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh man, do you think it was stolen?

quotes.speaker: Credit Card Rep
quotes.text: First would you mind verifying your home address?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Um, yes. [looks at Jim's pay stub] Um, 383 Linden Ave., Scranton PA

quotes.speaker: Credit Card Rep
quotes.text: And may I have the last four numbers of your Social Security Number?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Six-six-five-zero.

quotes.speaker: Credit Card Rep
quotes.text: Well Mr. Halpert. You're obviously not in San Juan Puerto Rico.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wait a minute. Yes I am.

quotes.speaker: Credit Card Rep
quotes.text: I'm going to go ahead and put a hold on your card.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. That...  I, I think that we should let the criminal use the card a little longer.

quotes.speaker: Credit Card Rep
quotes.text: Very funny sir. We'll get a new card out to you right away.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No-

quotes.speaker: Credit Card Rep
quotes.text: Have a nice day, and thank you!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Shoot.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: If you want to supplement your coverage, we can do that. If you want to replace your current coverage, all the better. Ah, you seem like a nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh he's not that nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not true.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hmm. Very true.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay shut up.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: Have you decided?

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Yeah, I'll have the linguini, red sauce on the side. If the sauce does not come on the side, I will send it back. I want garlic bread, toasted, not burnt. If it comes burnt, I will send it back.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: Okay then. And for you sir?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will have the gabba-gool.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: The... what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The gabba-gool.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: I don't really know what that is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [with Soprano's inflection] You know, gabba-gool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't, I don't have to have that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What he's trying to say is, Gabba. Gool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guys, guys-

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: I don't really think that we have that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Bring him the gabba-gool!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh. I will have the spaghetti, with a side salad.

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If the salad is on top, I send it back.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why would you cancel Jim's credit cards?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I usually can think quick on my feet, but they were so fast on the phone.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: This constitutes identity fraud.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh God. I wouldn't last in jail Oscar. I'm not like you.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What's that supposed to mean?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh you don't know about jail?  Oh you would love jail.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why would I love jail?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Because... You would love it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't think our company actually needs any more insurance. So I am out.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Look closely Michael. I feel there's a plan here for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Maybe we have a plan for you?

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: How about you? Maybe you can use supplemental coverage of some kind. Anybody can get hurt! You always think, it can't happen to you, and [drops hand loudly on table] Think about it.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: [approaches with child] Excuse me. Sorry to bother you. Are you a mechanic?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeeeeah.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: My battery is dead, I've got my kid, can you please help?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes I can.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no no, no. Come on. I'm sorry, we're having our salad.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Come on! Lady in distress?  Go! Go!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Thank you so much, I really appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, do you need any help?

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: I'm sure he can handle a simple jump-start. Now come on, sit down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He's a good mechanic.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Where were we?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He was trying to force you to decide on a policy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So we're choosing...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep, all right.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Check out Dental?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Put it down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Black goes on the red. With the... If we... Positive... Mo- it being a motor drive, it's probably down.

quotes.speaker: Kid
quotes.text: He seems bad at this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You want to do this junior? I didn't think so. Sorry. It's kind of a long day at the... mechanic store. [Andy places connections wrong, smoke and explosion set off] Aaaah!  You got a leaky spark tube.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: What?!?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So your car's totaled. Uh, you're just gonna want to get a refund on that. Or my guy could do it. He's great. But uh, I can't do that for you. I work exclusively on motorcycles. [Andy walks away, woman is exasperated]

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Now if you could just sign this letter of intent, I'll bring this back to my boss, and we can get this in motion. [Andy clears throat loudly]  You okay, Pat?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Just thinking about how, uh, I had this car, this Italian car, and I was driving it, and it kept telling me how much it needed oil, but I wouldn't give it any oil. And then, one day it exploded and it killed everyone and that's what I'm afraid of.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Aren't you a mechanic? Why wouldn't you put oil in the car?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It was before, my tech- my technical training.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't do it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Don't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Look Mike, I don't know what your friends are telling you, but you have to decide for yourself. Are these guys gonna take care of your things if you die tomorrow?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't understand, why would you buy a policy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's just the cost of a cup of coffee an hour.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You were man enough to back down Michael, I'm proud of you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I had to make a snap decision Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It wasn't a snap decision, you were sitting there for an hour.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was a lot of snap decisions.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you know what "snap decision" means?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It means like this. [snaps fingers]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just get in the car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh thank God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How did you get this number? Michael, we're on a catamaran.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It wasn't easy. I had to tell the hotel it was a medical emergency. I chose massive coronary, cause you told me that your Dad had a bad heart. Listen man, I, I got a problem, I think I'm in trouble with the mob. Or a major insurance carrier.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That sounds bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I know and you usually can get out of stuff like this, so I'm turning to you my friend.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm gonna help you through it all right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All you're gonna need to [faking a bad connection] and-  it- and then go to-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim? Are you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And then you'll be saved.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? Wait, I didn't hear a thing you just said.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just [drops] and then you'll be saved.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! God! I missed, I missed the important part again!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A- ah-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No!  Oh my God!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And you'll be saved.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Jim please, repeat what you're saying! I can't understand you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I [drops out] at the Bermuda Triangle. An-  M-  please don't call again.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim?!? [dial tone] Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey uh, question for you. I recently purchased some insurance that I can't afford given my present salary. Is there anything accounting-wise I can do to sort of make it all go away?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Accounting-wise, no. But phone-wise, just call up and cancel it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh no. Um. What about this Cash For Clunkers thing?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Just- no.  No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Well, it was a thought. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We have let Michael down, and it's 85 percent your fault.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: He's alive.  So you're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not on the inside he's not. Look at his life! Broke! Living in fear! No friends, dead end job.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, some of that existed before.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Not the living in fear, that's new.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You're right, that is new.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. He's got to stand up to this mafia guy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well I don't see that happening.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Me neither. Not the way things are now. But what if Michael felt no fear toward the mafia guy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you saying-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That we surgically remove the fear center from Michael's brain?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What is wrong with you? I am talking about convincing Michael that the guy's not mafia!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That seems a little far-fetched.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well more far-fetched than a mobster walking into a paper company for a low-level shakedown?  And that happened.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael. Incredible news. Grotti is clean.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. He's not. He's just good. Nothing sticks to him. You still don't understand how this works.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, Michael. What we're trying to say is, we made a mistake assuming he was mafia. I have a buddy who's a Fed, and we did a background check on the guy.  His background is perfectly clean.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's true, he's clean. I have a couple of friends still on the force. Checked with them. Ran his Fed friend up the flagpole to make sure he wasn't on the take. Turns out he's a totally lovely guy. Sweetest guy on the force really.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Class act. Boy scout.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But Grotti acts like he's mafia though.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: He's trying to intimidate you to close sales. He's just a pushy salesman.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And he made us all look like chumps!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [grunts]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: If there is one thing I hate more than the mafia it is a liar. I wish the mafia would go out and kill all the liars. Bury them in my yard. And I wouldn't tell the cops a thing. Not that I would be lying per se. But I would just get really quiet, all of a sudden.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: This is Grotti.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is Scott.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Oh! Great. Michael, I'm finishing up your paperwork right now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh really? Is that supposed to scare me?

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: I, I thought you'd be pleased.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well you thought wrong. Because I am not pleased. I'm actually kind of PO'd.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you know exactly why, because you were trying to scare me into buying insurance.

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: I don't get it. How was I scaring you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I think you knew exactly what you were doing. And frankly I think you were being a total and utter jerk.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You suck!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay that's-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I'm not gonna buy your stupid insurance.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's good, let's wrap it up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How about that? The only person that actually needs insurance is you, if you show your face around here again, got it?

quotes.speaker: Grotti
quotes.text: Look, Michael, when we all calm down here, maybe at some point in the future, you change your mind, why don't you give me a call?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Doubt it. [disconnects call]

quotes.speaker: {Dwight} and {Andy}
quotes.text: [relaxing] Oh man.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What a tool. [Dwight and Andy exchange looks] What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Next time you look in the mirror, you're gonna be looking at a guy who stood down the mafia!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. What do you mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We just told you he wasn't mafia, so you wouldn't be scared.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You successfully backed down the mob!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You made the mafia apologize to you! You made the mafia be polite!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh man. I should be mad at you guys. But I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I looked him in the eye and I said, "Not today Grotti, Not today. And not tomorrow, and not the next day. Or the day after that. And you can tell all your friends that if I see them, then they're already dead." I said something like that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Very close.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Just to be clear, he backed down an insurance agent from Mutual of Harrisburg.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Erin?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Coffee?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Not from the kitchen. Stop and Shop. If it's not Stop and Shop, I send it back.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Large. If it's a medium I send it back. If it's an extra large I send it back.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: How do you return coffee?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Go.  Any questions?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [on phone] Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hi Pam, is Jim there?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Listen our credit card has been cancelled and we have to deal with that, and I really can't handle the fact that you're calling us here!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay, that sounds good. Um, I'll let you go, just -tell Jim, that I said hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh I will. I will Kevin. I will make that my top priority.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Cool. Okay. [Pam hangs up] Bye.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: They have no idea what happened.
